document_data.caption: The fabled four-leaf clover.
document_data.name: Clover
document_data.mainbody: '''Clovers''' were a type of small, flowering plant. They were highly associated with good luck,{{Cite dragon/276/Black Cats and Broken Mirrors|37}}

Varieties.Daggerdale Brown Clover:
These clovers had triangular brown leaves, smelled of [[mint]], and were [[poison]]ous. This species of clover came about in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], at some point prior to the writing of ''[[The Settled Lands (book)|The Settled Lands]]'' in the [[Elminster's Ecologies (in-universe)|''Elminster's Ecologies'']] series of [[book]]s, when a swarm of [[bee]]s in Daggerdale contaminated a field with pollen from the [[Border Forest]]'s [[cocoa|jade cocoa]].
[[File:Dark Clover.png|thumb|''A dark clover.'']]
Varieties.Dark Clover: A type of clover that emerged following the [[Spellplague]]. These were near identical to the standard variety of clover, but they had some connection to the [[Shadowfell]] that made them a sort of aid to practitioners of [[necromancy]].

document_data.Usages: * A four-leaf clover was a [[material component]] for the [[spell]] ''[[boon of fortune]]''.
document_data.Rumors & Legends:
* Some claimed that out of every one hundred or even one thousand clovers, only one grew to have exactly four leaves and that whoever picked it was granted good luck.
* Superstitions surrounding four-leaf clovers claimed that they could enable one to see hidden fairies, detect [[witch]]es, or recognize [[evil]] [[spirit]]s.
document_data.Trivia:
* The enchanted luck-enhancing [[belt]] ''[[cloverleaf]]'' was so named for having a four-leaf clover stuck in its buckle's clasp.<ref>
* Clovers were the holy symbol of the [[deity]] [[Sqeulaiche]].
